section.name: Determining dependencies between modules
section.p: In order to build a manifest, i.e. to build all its modules, the manifest needs to determine dependencies with other modules defined in the manifest as well as dependencies with (third-party) libraries. A good example of how such a mechanism would work is Maven. A single Maven-enabled project contains a project.xml file in which binary dependencies are defined. Maven reactor adds one extra methodology, where multiple modules (projects in Maven terminology) are managed using a the reactor tool.
